page.title: 03HOUSING - NEWHURST GATE
page.content: In the summer of 1977 my husband and I moved our mobile home to Newhurst to settle amongst farmers and small- holders. Working only 5-1/2 miles away at Seend in a family business enabled us to embark on a near impossible task of completely renovating our farm cottages on a 1/3 acre Â£9,000 plot. The hours spent, evenings and weekends for 3 years, often in freezing con- ditions, filled us with a little pride and an investment worth Â£55,000. Now we have a daughter of 5yrs; a thriving fine arts business, and our final project is to purchase 2.5acres (Â£8,000) upon which we plan, with aid from local conservation and forestry authorities,to fence,plant and install a wildfowl pond; to provide ground for grazing stock and to replace native species, elms which in the 60's were decimated by Dutch Elm disease.
